Reviews.Title: m421vt
Reviews.Author: tv man
Reviews.Content: I just picked up this television this morning actually and so far I am enjoying it very much. It is a very easy set up. Just plug it in and it guides you through the steps and then plug in all your cables and you will be watching t.v. in no time. Picture quality is great for the price. However I did notice some slight lag during fast motion sequences while the t.v. is still warming up. It does go away once it is warmed up. I find the sound to be very good. Its no bose surround sound system by any means but for a $700 price tag it sounds really good whether its a dvd, video game, t.v. etc. It has a great slim and sleek look to it and looks great sitting on my tv stand. The vizio internet apps are without a doubt first generation style apps. Definitely not on par with app's you will find on smart phones. Even so, still cool that I can check my facebook page with the t.v. remote while still watching t.v. Looking forward to future applications and better designed applications though I do understand that this is not a computer.Overall I am very happy with the purchaseEdit 1/21/11. Image lag still affecting picture. Seems to happen during scenes that have bright background. Highly noticeable when  people move across the screen or camera view moves across scenery. Looks like a trail of enlarged and jumbled pixels that follow objects during movement of object or camera movement across object.  I heard through the grapevine that this is a known problem with vizios but have yet to call the company to confirm. When I do I will edit this review with the feedback. I would lower my ratingto a 3.4 for this product.Edit 2/09/11. The t.v. Is  presenting even more issues now. Twice within about 20 total hours of t.v. Viewing, the t.v. Shuts itself off and performs a power cycle. Power cycles are basically the equivalent of restarting your computer when a problem arises. I've contacted vizio and they had me tweak some settings. Obviously those tweaks did nothing. I am going to call them back and hopefully they take the thing back.Also, image lag as I described in earlier edit still exists. Hasn't gotten any better or worse but definitely not gone away. Went to the store where I bought the t.v. And watched the m421vt display model. I noticed the same lag on that t.v. That appears on mine, which would lead me to believe that this is not just a problem with my particular tv but a problem with the entire line of m421vt's.I would now rate this tv a 2 out of 5 and I'm going to say that this thing is a lemon. Avoid purchase of this product and keep saving enough until you can get a higher quality tv.Edit 7/23/11. About 3 months ago vizio took the problematic tv back and sent me a "new one" still have the same problem as the old one but no where near as frequent. Be sure and send in your warranty cards when purchasing the tv.  !!

Reviews.Title: have to learn this tv to make it great
Reviews.Author: critique10304
Reviews.Content: Ok, first things first.  I want to address the issue with this tv turning off automatically...If you turn off the adaptive luma, smart dimming, and ambient lighting...no probelems, but it seems like features you pay for that you aren't using.  Next, I believe the factory presets are just trash, so I bought a calibration disc from Disney called WOW which is very comprehensive.  After calibration the tv is awesome.  Here are the settings with a dimly lit room...Picture Mode = Movie  Backlight = 40  Brightness = 39  Contrast = 52  Color = 47  Tint = -5  Sharpness = 16  Color Temperature = All 128  Smooth Motion effect = off  Real Cinema Mode = Precision  Noise Reduction = High  Color Enhancement = Normal  Adaptive Luma = Off  Film Mode = Auto  Smart dimming = off  Ambient light sensor = offKeep in mind, these are optimal settings for a ps3 blu-ray player, so settings can vary...if too bright just drop the backlight level.  It was a lot of work getting the settings just right, which is why I only give it a 4...Hope this helps people who are looking to buy and for those who have already bought and were not happy with the results.  Peace

Reviews.Title: High quality product
Reviews.Author: Dustin
Reviews.Content: I upgraded from an old Westinghouse 42" 720p to this TV and couldn't be happier.  I was torn between this and a Sony Bravia 40", but feel I have made the right choice.  I had my doubts as it didn't have a lot of reviews and one noted some issues that seemed somewhat bothersome.  I haven't noticed any of these issues luckily.Upgrading from a much older LCD to a new LED back-lit LCD obviously has improvements.  As I just got this TV a few days ago, I haven't been able to fully test out the 1080p resolution, but the difference is easily noticeable between the TVs running cable at 720p/1080i.  From what I did try in 1080p looked far improved.The Apps work well aside from netflix freezing once and forcing the TV to restart, but I use it a lot and rarely have any problems.  I don't have much to compare it to as this is the only TV I've used that has any applications, but it is more than enough for me.  There is still room for improvement, but as it upgraded the firmware the first day I had it, I feel it shouldn't have any problems advancing.Overall a great product.  Fair priced and good performance.  I feel most people won't regret this purchase, but suggest seeing the TVs in action to pick what's right for them.I will edit this review if there are any problems.UPDATEThis TV does "reset" quite often.  And also there is an issue with the smart dimming.  If there is a screen with a lot of black for an extended period of time (for me it was GTAIV's pause screen) it will shut off the screen.  Luckily all you have to do is turn off smart dimming.  As for the constant resets, I am currently looking into it.  Dropped to 4 stars.  The resets are tolerable, just annoying.UPDATE 2The resets no longer seem to be occurring.  It might have been fixed, I'll update again if it seems to start happening again.  But for now back up to 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: TV goes blank - known firmware issue that remains uncorrected
Reviews.Author: RCSails
Reviews.Content: VIZIO M421VT 42-Inch 120 Hz Class Edge Lit Razor LED LCD HDTV with VIZIO Internet Apps, BlackThis TV goes blank for about one minute periodically without warning. Product support says it is known firmware issue that they have know about since Jan2011 but have not issued new firmware to correct as of 26Jun2011. They call it watch-dogging, TV is looking for new firmware and when it can't find it it shuts down to protect itself.

Reviews.Title: Great TV at a Great Price
Reviews.Author: rphgary
Reviews.Content: I am extremely happy with this Vizio television.  The picture is bright, vivid, and sharp; the TV itself is amazingly thin; and the interface (including web apps) is smooth and intuitive (especially with the slide-out qwerty keyboard on the remote.)  Overall, this is a quality product with great features at a bargain price.  I would recommend this TV to anyone looking for a LED TV with Internet connectivity.

Reviews.Title: good only after i got it replaced
Reviews.Author: prv
Reviews.Content: Ethernet connection did not work on my tv and had to put replacement with vizio right on the first day!they took couple weeks to replace my unit but after that it has been good..picture quality is good although it varies lot on source of your signalvia apps are not like super cool but they do their job to get me some good stuff streaming..( not very happy with interface but once i get pass that stage and get streaming, its all good)overall happy .. not very heavy user for TV

Reviews.Title: VIZIO Razor LED M421VT
Reviews.Author: bargainproducts0
Reviews.Content: I don't have much to say except that this is a great TV for the price. have a great picture quality and respond really nice to games (PS3, XBOX360). I will recommend this product anytime.Vizio App need more improvement but in general i think good, if you really looking to replace your computer then this is not the right option for you but for check your FB and change your status work perfect.

Reviews.Title: Vizio makes a poor quality product - no picture
Reviews.Author: Michael McCray
Reviews.Content: I have had this TV for less than two years. The picture will not turn on. In doing research, I have discovered that a fuse has apparently blown. This means I either open it up and solder a new fuse to the board or buy a new TV. Do a search for "Vizio TV's suck" or "Vizio TV picture won't come on". Either of those searches will reveal that this is a common problem occurring within 6 mos to two years of owning a Vizio and it afflicts most of their TV products. This is clearly a design flaw that should make anyone buy anything but a Vizio.

Reviews.Title: Great picture but didn't last.
Reviews.Author: Jo Ann Moschetto
Reviews.Content: We bought this TV in August of 2011.  Today, February 26, 2014, the screen went black.  I called Vizio to learn that the back light needed to be replaced.  It was out of warranty but thank God I purchased the extended warranty through Walmart so they are coming to fix it.  Vizio said that this was a problem with this particular tv so stay away from it.

Reviews.Title: Best 42" LED TV For The Price (with as many features it has), Hands Down No Question!!!
Reviews.Author: J.O - thirdeyeinsight . org "Joe"
Reviews.Content: This tv is absolutely amazing, hands down best tv I own or have ever owned!!!I have a Toshiba 32" LED 3D 240Hz (which is still working 2.5 years I've had it with no defect in any quality. It's picture quality and anti-motion blurr features are amazing for watching Football, Hockey, and playing Videogames. I have a 37" HD LCD 1080p insignia 120Hz that some tube or bulb inside the tv broke (the screen went black one day during use of it, but it ended up being a $150 repair and it still work's today) this insignia I have owned and it's been heavily used since I purchased it in 2006, and lastly I have a Hitachi 32" HD LCD 720P 60Hz, which I've had for 2 years as a guest tv (for friends to bring over their gaming systems and use).This Vizio Razor 42" LED, Anti-Motion Blurr, Energy Saver, 4 HDMI ports, and the ability for the Remote that came with the tv to pe programmed to your cable box so you can have a more convenient universal remote, which for me is great because I have too many remotes as it is..This tv is so much better than I could've ever expected it to be, and for it's price I decided in a matter of 2-3 minutes to purchase this tv rather than risking my luck on Black Friday (or cyber Monday.My only complaint with this refurbished 42" Vizio M421VT (which is a very, very minor complaint; but still not something I'm a fan of nonetheless. On the front of the Tv there's a nice backlit Vizio emblem, the only issue with that is the backlit Vizio emblem is always lit. The only time the brightness/intensity of the VIZIO Emblem chances slightly is from when the tv is either off or it's turned on.

Reviews.Title: Tuner and firmware issues
Reviews.Author: California Dreamin "sr538"
Reviews.Content: The picture and audio quality have been fine.  However, the TV reboots or loses tuner tracking often enough to be annoying.  The problems happen mostly with tuner programming, less often with cable signals.  The firmware for this model has not been updated in several years.  My next TV will not be a Vizio.

Reviews.Title: Power Cycling Is the Only Downside
Reviews.Author: LisaLisa
Reviews.Content: I'll admit this is my first LED High Def TV (never had an LCD one before).  It's been a year and a half and, knock on wood, the only downside has been the "power cycling," that occurs about once every 3-6 months for no apparent reason.  I guess that's good news since I never filled out my Warranty card...but at this point I'd be out of warranty anyway.  The last time it happened I Googled it and ran across these reviews or else I never would have known what was happening.  They don't mention it in the trouble shooting guide, and I think they should. It's slightly annoying and I wish it didn't happen but that's been my only major issue.  Oh wait, I forgot, I had a hell of a time setting up the Netflix app on my TV.  Not a big deal because I decided that app is crap anyway so I never subscribed.I was afraid I'd never use the apps but I sometimes do use Pandora and use to use Hulu (until they stopped carrying 30 Rock, then it was no longer worth it!).I did notice the slight picture lag others have mentioned but I had a friend help me play with the settings and I haven't had an issue since.My guess is that people who like this TV never bother to post comments since it appears that there are a lot of negative reviews on this TV and I haven't had any major issues.  Fingers crossed I get at least another couple years of use out of it, it was expensive!

Reviews.Title: Died after 1 month after warranty expired.
Reviews.Author: M. Panzanella
Reviews.Content: Used only 2-3 hours per week in a bedroom setup.  Slow to startup.  Internet apps only OK since they are slow.  Picture quality is pretty good, but the grainy with an SD picture.  Picture averaging improves this but results in an unnatural video.  Illuminated Vizio logo stinks in low light environments (like a bedroom).  I have to cover it up since it's way brighter than a night light.  Can't find a way to turn it off either.Biggest issue... wife turned the unit on then immediately off on accident.  Then it went into its blinking state of death.  i.e. the Vizio logo flashes after plugin.  Power button does nothing.  Vizio claims their failure rates are low, but the net has many people complaining about this failure mode.  People also say it's about $200-$300 to have diagnosed and fixed.  Joy.I bought a motherboard off Ebay for $73.  Hopefully this will fix it.  I have many other non-Vizio LCD TV's that get way more usage and have not had an issue.  Many friends and family also good luck with non-Vizio TV's.  This is the first and last Vizio TV I buy.

Reviews.Title: Unrepairable junk
Reviews.Author: A_P
Reviews.Content: I had this TV for 1 year and 2 months. It lasted just enough to go out of warranty. Then the screen went black. The rest is still working and I can even see the picture if I shine with a flashlight on the surface. I called Vizio customer service and they said the lamp went bad and it is not a serviceable part (none actually are). The customer service rep plainly told me TO JUST THROW THE TV OUT AND BUY A NEW ONE.Bottom line: Vizio products are not reliable and not repairable. I will never buy anything from them again. I like my expensive equipment to last more than 1 year or at least be repairable at a reasonable cost.

Reviews.Title: Visio could do better
Reviews.Author: Lawrence
Reviews.Content: I give it a very generous 2 stars. The internet apps are not very useful, this was the reason I bought this one. I wish I would have waited and purchased a higher quality tv instead of one for the internet feature.The picture is sharp and crisp, a little too much so. It makes everything look a little less life like. It's hard to explain, but everything looks a little bit fake. Especially backgrounds & CGI special effects on lower budget shows.From time to time the tv will re-boot itself, it shuts down then you have to wait for it to cycle. This seems to be a little more often than it was a month ago.I would advise to get a tv without the internet stuff. Get a Blu-Ray player with internet apps instead, if you have to have it, they are a lot cheaper to replace if something goes wrong.

Reviews.Title: Great Value and Amazing TV!
Reviews.Author: K. BENYOUSSEF
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of homework when looking to upgrade my living room set and when I saw that this could be had for under $700 I decided to jump on it!The visual and audio aspect on this set is amazing! If you like to watch sports (football, hockey, baseball) you will see what I'm talking about.  Crisp, amazing digital picture (when HDMI is in use) and the sound is very good as well. You will feel like you're at the game, trust me and the best thing is there is no lagging or blotched images when the football game is going at full speed, it's truly amazing.One of the best features is the ability to you use the VIA apps.  Being able to stream Pandora on there is very awesome. I have not watched a Blu-Ray on this set yet but I'm sure it will be good considering I watched 300 (on Comcast Xfinity again connected w/ an HDMI) and it was absolutely spectacular.I was skeptical at first because I debated spending a higher amount for a Samsung or Sony and didn't know much about Vizio and after this experience I am very pleased and am very likely to buy a Vizio again in the future.

Reviews.Title: Vizio 421VT 42 in. LED
Reviews.Author: The Wave
Reviews.Content: I have used this now for over a month and this is a excellent TV. Great picture and sound. An LED with forward facing speakers. I tweeked one of the provided custom settings and the pictre is perfect. No motion or weird dimming. The built-in internet is great, firmware updates and easy streaming of sites provided by Vizio. Netflix works really well but many of the widgets provided require a fee.  The Amazon provided site has new movies at a lower price than On Demand. I still have my Roku hooked up and this looks great with this set and has more free sites with movies. The remote and keyboard are extensive/complete but have small keys. It takes some time to get used to it. The remote works well with the cable box. This set is a great buy.

Reviews.Title: apps are not worth it
Reviews.Author: mashumafi
Reviews.Content: I got the tv a few days ago. After plugging it in it takes some time before i can turn it on. after i turn it on it takes time to start up. there are very few apps, most of what it has is already on my xbox. The remote is decent, could use lit qwerty, but nbd. Box was easy to open, stand was easy to put on.

Reviews.Title: Fantasic Product
Reviews.Author: Richard
Reviews.Content: Currently have 8 HD TV's all used over the air and this one over the internet as well. This is by far the best that I own. The Vizio has a great HD receiver. I love the True sound which stops volume rise on commercials etc. I have DSL and when watching movies from net-flix or Amazon there are not any buffering delays using the wireless internet access. Unbeievablly great picture in any lighting conditions and the Vizio is located in my family room which has a skylight which made viewing difficult during the daytime with previous TV's, not so with the Vizio. I am well pleased with this product and all of its features.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY VIZIO TVS WITH INTERNET APPS
Reviews.Author: dk
Reviews.Content: I bought a vizio t.v. just over a year ago and had problems connecting to internet last night through my apps.  After contacting my dsl service provider, I figured out they were not the problem.  So, I contacted Vizio and they figured out it was the television that needed to be repaired.  Since I have had the tv just over a year, it would not be covered under warranty.  Vizio said the work would cost 301.00 to repair the t.v.  I paid almost 1600.00 when I bought my tv brand new.  Save yourself the money and trouble, and buy a tv from respected brand that has been around for a while.  You may read other reviews where people say they love their vizio.  Unfortunately, they probably have just purchased their televisions and have not had them the time I have.

Reviews.Title: It was decent
Reviews.Author: Luis
Reviews.Content: Shipping was fast and reliable...but, the TV showed no image and when it did it was just a bunch of lines running through itI got lucky that no one had registered it with Vizio so i was able to get a new one.I was a bit disappointed because they said it was "100% guaranteed" to work. But i was pleased with Vizio's help.so in the end i was pretty happy with my purchase.
